title: Flu Shot
description: Get payment allowances & effective dates for the 2023-2024 season.
cleaned_text: Flu Shot Get [payment allowances & effective dates](/medicare/payment/fee-for-service-providers/part-b-drugs/average-drug-sales-price/vaccine-pricing) for the 2023-2024 season. This content is for health care providers. If you're a person with Medicare, learn more about [flu shots](https://www.medicare.gov/coverage/flu-shots). Patients 65 and older should get a preferred vaccine if available. Preferred vaccines are potentially more effective than standard dose flu vaccines. There are 3 recommended vaccines: vaccine](https://www.cdc.gov/flu/prevent/adjuvant.htm) If one of these recommended vaccines isn't available, give your patients a standard-dose flu vaccine instead. Frequency & Coverage - The CDC recommends annual flu shots for everyone 6 months and older each flu season. September and October are the best times for most people to get vaccinated. - Medicare Part B covers the seasonal flu shot. - We cover additional flu shots if medically necessary. Patients can get flu shots twice in a calendar year during 2 different flu seasons, and we'll pay for both shots. - Your patients pay nothing if you accept assignment. There's no copayment, coinsurance, or deductible. - Find out when your patient is [eligible for the flu shot](/files/document/checking-medicare-eligibility.pdf). We give information from claims billed in the last 18 months: - CPT or HCPCS codes - Dates of service - NPIs who administered the shots If you need help, contact your eligibility service provider. Billing - All providers who administer the flu shot must accept assignment. - You may use roster billing or submit an individual claim. Learn more about [roster billing, mass immunizers, and centralized billing](/medicare/coding-billing/roster). - Entities, like local health facilities, must get an [NPI (PDF)](/outreach-and-education/medicare-learning-network-mln/mlnproducts/downloads/npi-what-you-need-to-know.pdf)if they've never submitted Medicare claims. [Skilled nursing facility enforcement discretion for pharmacy billing](/medicare/payment/covid-19/snf-enforcement-discretion-relating-certain-pharmacy-billing)ended on June 30, 2023. You can bill for flu shot administration and vaccine products with dates of service from September 20, 2021 - June 30, 2023.
